docs.lead_paragraph: After getting the cold shoulder, U.S. health insurer Anthem Inc. said it's raising its offer to buy smaller rival Cigna Corp. for about $47 billion, including cash and stock.

headline.main: Anthem Proposes to Buy Cigna for $184 Per Share
headline.print_headline: Anthem Proposes to Buy Cigna for $184 Per Share

docs.snippet: After getting the cold shoulder, U.S. health insurer Anthem Inc. said it's raising its offer to buy smaller rival Cigna Corp. for about $47 billion, including cash and stock.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. health insurer Anthem Inc said on Saturday it had offered $47 billion (£29.6 billion) in cash and stock for smaller rival Cigna Corp, signalling a pick-up in the industry's long-awaited consolidation.

headline.main: Anthem Offers $47 Billion for Cigna as Insurers Race for a Deal
headline.print_headline: Anthem Offers $47 Billion for Cigna as Insurers Race for a Deal

docs.snippet: U.S. health insurer Anthem Inc said on Saturday it had offered $47 billion (£29.6 billion) in cash and stock for smaller rival Cigna Corp, signalling a pick-up in the industry's long-awaited consolidation.

docs.lead_paragraph: The University of Illinois gave a nearly $48,500 payout to a former assistant women's basketball coach who left amid accusations that he mistreated players, a newspaper reported Saturday.

headline.main: $48,000 Payout for Illinois Coach Who Left Amid Allegations
headline.print_headline: $48,000 Payout for Illinois Coach Who Left Amid Allegations

docs.lead_paragraph: After making headlines with a nasty split over trade, President Barack Obama and Nancy Pelosi, the top Democrat in the House of Representatives, made a public show on Friday of making up.

headline.main: After Trade Spat, Obama and Pelosi Kiss and Make Up (Literally)
headline.print_headline: After Trade Spat, Obama and Pelosi Kiss and Make Up (Literally)

docs.lead_paragraph: A nonpartisan government study says repealing President Barack Obama's signature health care law would modestly increase the budget deficit and the number of uninsured Americans would rise by more than 20 million.

headline.main: Study Says Repealing 'Obamacare' Would Add to Budget Deficit
headline.print_headline: Study Says Repealing 'Obamacare' Would Add to Budget Deficit

docs.snippet: A nonpartisan government study says repealing President Barack Obama's signature health care law would modestly increase the budget deficit and the number of uninsured Americans would rise by more than 20 million.

docs.lead_paragraph: The nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office said repealing the Affordable Care Act would increase federal deficits and the number of uninsured Americans, but it would also raise economic output.

headline.main: Mixed Effects Are Seen on an Affordable Care Act Repeal
headline.print_headline: Mixed Effects Are Seen on a Health Law Repeal

docs.abstract: Study by nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office uses new methods of fiscal analysis to determine that repeal of Affordable Care Act would increase federal budget deficit and leave more Americans uninsured but would also raise economic output, giving people incentives to work more.
docs.snippet: The nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office said repealing the Affordable Care Act would increase federal deficits and the number of uninsured Americans, but it would also raise economic output.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Chinese hacking group suspected of stealing sensitive information about millions of current and former U.S. government employees has a different mission and organizational structure than the military hackers who have been accused of other U.S. data breaches, according to people familiar with the matter.
